sql.Tip: SQL stands for Structured Query Language, and is the primary language used for working with relational databases.
CRUD = Create Read Update Delete.  A good database makes it easy to do all of these things.
There are many different dialects of SQL, including MySQL, PostresQL, ORACLE, and MSSQL.  Most of the syntax is the same but there are some differences.
A PRIMARY KEY identify records on a table, while a FORIEGN KEY establishes the relationship between different tables.
An outline, or map, of a database is often referred to as a SCHEMA.
